intro: Eremophila albicans, commonly known as the white eremophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract nectar-feeding insects. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its hairy leaves and deep root system. Eremophila albicans is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
